raw_comment: I notice that in the lower Texas area and LA,The leaves begin to show first in January,and in the Dakotas,Minnesota,Montana and others in the north,the leaves show surprisingly late.I wonder why the order of leaves falling go from the south to north,instead of the east to west. I also wonder if the Leaf growth could have to do with global warming,Like if the temperature becomes troublesome for leaves to sprout
ace_sentences: I notice a pattern in the lower Texas area and in LA.
In the lower Texas area and in LA, leaves begin to show in January.
I notice a pattern in the Dakotas, in Minnesota, and in Montana.
The Dakotas are in the north.
In the Dakotas, in Minnesota, and in Montana, leaves show late.
I wonder why the order of leaves falling goes from the south to the north.
I wonder why the order of leaves falling does not go from the east to the west.
I wonder whether leaf growth relates to global warming.
I wonder whether global warming makes the temperature troublesome for leaves to sprout.
